discussion.content: While using vRealize Operations for VMware Horizon you notice that the Horizon RDS Pools Dashboard displays the message in the exhibit. What should be done to resolve the issue?

choices.A: Verify that the vRealize Operations for Horizon Desktops agent is installed on the RDSH servers
choices.B: Set the RDS Pools Dashboard as the default dashboard
choices.C: Ensure that RDS licensing has been configured for the RDS servers

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

While using vRealize Operations for VMware Horizon you notice that the Horizon RDS Pools Dashboard displays the message in the exhibit.
What should be done to resolve the issue?

discussion.content: B does not make sense. The broker agent is only installed on a Horizon Connection Server host. Since IP address is used, it's not D. So I think the obvious answers are A and C.

I agree with Poker69

Answer is A and C
I agree with Ankoji A and C make complete sense..
B is wrong, Horizon Broker Agent is installed on Connection Server, not virtual desktops.
A y B is the correct answers https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2140844

I think the obvious are AB
Virtual desktops = Horizon Connection Server

Yes , B does not make sense. Broker agent installed on View Connection server and not on Virtual desktops. Answer is A and C. http://www.virtualizationblog.com/installing-and-configuring-vmware-view-broker-agent-on-horizon-connection-server/

choices.D: Configure DNS to properly resolve the hostnames
choices.B: Start the VMware vRealize Operations for Horizon Broker Agent service on the virtual desktops
choices.A: Configure the firewall to allow communications
choices.C: Verify that the pairing key is correct

questions.question_text:
Review the exhibit.
//IMG//

While a View administrator is configuring the vRealize for Horizon Broker Agent, the error message in the exhibit is displayed.
What two actions should the administrator take to resolve the issue? (Choose two.)

choices.B: Member of the Domain Admins group
choices.A: Member of the Domain Users group
choices.C: Member of the Local Power Users group
choices.D: Member of the Local Administrators group

questions.question_text: What is the minimum user accounts privilege requirement when installing App Volumes 2.x?

discussion.content:
Prerequisites

Download the App Volumes installer.
Ensure that you have the SQL Server authentication details with you.
Verify that your environment meets the system requirements. See Infrastructure and Networking Requirements and Software Requirements.
Verify that your account has local administrator privileges on the target server
Hardware level â€“ The recommended hardware level is the highest that all hosts support, with Version 11 as the minimum.
